#summary The navigator.userAgent property
#labels about-dom,is-dom-property

== Values ==

The `navigator.userAgent` property returns a string.
  * [BrowserFamilyFirefox Firefox] returns `"Mozilla 5.0"` followed by your operating system, system language, Gecko rendering engine version number, build date, browser name, and browser version.  Example: `"Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.4) Gecko/20070515 Firefox/2.0.0.4"`
  * [BrowserFamilyMSIE Internet Explorer] returns `"Mozilla 4.0 (compatible;"` followed by your browser name and version, operating system and version, and various installed system components.  Example: `"Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; InfoPath.1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.04506.30)"`
  * [BrowserFamilySafari Safari] returns ...
  * [BrowserFamilyOpera Opera] returns `"Opera/"` followed by your browser version, operating system and version, and browser language.  Example: `"Opera/9.21 (Windows NT 5.1; U; en)"`

This property is read-only.

== Usage ==

Most browsers provide options or extensions that allow you to change the user-agent string your browser sends when it requests resources from a server.  Web developers should not rely on the value of the `navigator.userAgent` property.
